About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

BIO

Hello, my name is Brendan Fisher and I am an Honors Computer Science student at the University of Florida. I am a member of the Undergraduate Research Scholars Program as well as numerous clubs at school including Gator Motorsports, the Wakeboard club, the Programming Team, and the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) among other things.

Work Experience

Wilson & Girgenti, LLC

Mechanical Engineering Intern

  • Facilitated the implementation of a Python script to automate area calculations in AutoCAD drawings
  • Authored company guidelines on beginning new design projects
  • Led site visits to plot out existing HVAC systems in need of modification or renovation
  • Communicated with suppliers to ensure product specifications met the needs of the current project

Hobbies

School Related

As mentioned, at school I enjoy taking part in club activities such as Gator Motorsports, where we construct a car from the ground up, the Programming Team, where we compete to solve prgramming problems, and other activities

Extracurricular

Besides school related activities, I also spend my time competing in the intramural ultimate frisbee league, playing spikeball with friends, and going wakeboarding with the Gator Wake club

Accomplishments

Benacquisto Award Recipient

I received the Benacquisto Scholarship as recognition for outstanding performance on the PSAT my junior year of high school

Undergraduate Research Scholars Program

An extremely exclusive program comprised of only 336 students of the entire incoming class

Honors Program

A program consisting of the top 10% of the incoming student body
